item.title:
R to @0xTaker: Would like to thank @0xperp and @0xDamian0x for their insightful feedback. Nate (@0xperp) is the real person to look at for everything news-based trading and prediction markets!
Have been meaning to post this in December, but a lot of things got busy, so there you are - enjoy!
item.dc:creator: @0xTaker
item.description:

item.title:
Has been a while.
Publishing this (long overdue) piece on arbitrage trading the US elections through @Polymarket, @Kalshi, @DriftProtocol and a bunch of other CEXs and DEXs and the strategies involved, alongside my own thoughts on PMs as a whole.
https://taker.mirror.xyz/ZcfYR06Vkccv8Fx71IpiWEoYGqXdoGMyOdcMu1_TkVA

item.description:
ğŸš¨WE'RE BACKğŸš¨

Kicking off 2025 by chatting all things @solana MEV!

Together with the @0xGhostLogs team; Chief Penguin, @chrischang43 AKA Product/Full-Stack/GTM, and Data-whisperer, George AKA (Backend/Infrastructure/EVM)

In this episode we discuss:

â€¢ Solana MEV & sandwich attacks
â€¢ Solana MEV competition
â€¢ Liquidity provisions & lowering MEV impact
â€¢ Validators
â€¢ Novel attack strategies: CeFi/DeFi arb, liquidity snipping
â€¢ MEV: Ethereum vs Solana
â€¢ MEV mitigation tools
â€¢ Slippage indexing
â€¢ Ghostâ€™s 2025 roadmap
â€¢ Parallel EVM visualizer
â€¢ What needs solving in 2025?

And a special announcement at the ~30 minute mark ğŸ‘€ â€” enjoy!
â€”

item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: firms that invested deeply into building out onchain token trading capabilities in the early years (wintermute + scp) developed a massive edge and are making $$ now
firms that invested deeply into building out onchain NFT trading capabilities (MMs, price oracles etc) are dead
item.dc:creator: @kapursanat
item.description:

item.title: R to @0xTaker: There are a lot of silent underdogs that I could list winning the right battles (not Twitter arguments), positioning themselves more and more to win in their respective categories - that's all a part of the work that goes into building something long lasting
item.dc:creator: @0xTaker
item.description: There are a lot of silent underdogs that I could list winning the right battles (not Twitter arguments), positioning themselves more and more to win in their respective categories - that's all a part of the work that goes into building something long lasting

item.title:
"I wish we could have X" "___ does X already" "But that's not really X"
Seeing this on the timeline gets incredibly boring for which very few are actual nerdsnipes but everything else is just plain shilling
There's a lot that separates a good product from a great product, and teams that work on the latter trying to nail it day-in-day-out succeed organically from inspiring such behavioural change from their early users to the late majority
item.dc:creator: @0xTaker
item.description:
"I wish we could have X"
"___ does X already"
"But that's not really X"

Seeing this on the timeline gets incredibly boring for which very few are actual nerdsnipes but everything else is just plain shilling

There's a lot that separates a good product from a great product, and teams that work on the latter trying to nail it day-in-day-out succeed organically from inspiring such behavioural change from their early users to the late majority

item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: We Canâ€™t Do Chain Abstraction Without Fast Bridging ft. @ptrwtts ğŸ™ï¸
@arjunnchand sits down with Peter, founder of @RelayProtocol & @reservoir0x, and unpacks a story that starts with NFTs and ends with a protocol reshaping how value moves across chains.
They dive into the battle of intents vs. token standards, the challenges of scaling solvers, and why chain abstraction might just be the hardest UX problem in crypto.
Donâ€™t miss it!
Key timestamps from the episode:
0:00 - How User Feedback Led to Building a Bridge 4:23 - Relayâ€™s 2024: Launch, Adoption, and Momentum 7:25 - Why Relay Became a Solver-First Protocol 11:54 - Whatâ€™s Next for Relayâ€™s Solver? 15:33 - What Sets Intent Protocols Apart? 19:25 - Hydra, Stargate, and the Token Standards Debate 28:00 - Token Standards vs L2 Sequencers: The Security Debate 31:13 - Why Is Chain Abstraction Hard Mode? 38:28 - Whatâ€™s Next for Relay
item.dc:creator: @lifiprotocol
item.description:
We Canâ€™t Do Chain Abstraction Without Fast Bridging ft. @ptrwtts ğŸ™ï¸

@arjunnchand sits down with Peter, founder of @RelayProtocol & @reservoir0x, and unpacks a story that starts with NFTs and ends with a protocol reshaping how value moves across chains.

They dive into the battle of intents vs. token standards, the challenges of scaling solvers, and why chain abstraction might just be the hardest UX problem in crypto.

Donâ€™t miss it!

Key timestamps from the episode:

0:00 - How User Feedback Led to Building a Bridge
4:23 - Relayâ€™s 2024: Launch, Adoption, and Momentum
7:25 - Why Relay Became a Solver-First Protocol

31:13 - Why Is Chain Abstraction Hard Mode?

item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: Solana MEV Report: Trends, Insights & Challenges
Today @heliuslabs releasing a comprehensive overview of the current Solana MEV landscape, detailing the various forms of MEV observed on the network today.
It includes concrete examples and quantifiable, contextual data to illustrate the scope and impact of MEV. The report also explores strategies and mechanisms to mitigate or eliminate harmful MEV practices.
item.dc:creator: @__lostin__
item.description:
Solana MEV Report: Trends, Insights & Challenges

Today @heliuslabs releasing a comprehensive overview of the current Solana MEV landscape, detailing the various forms of MEV observed on the network today.

It includes concrete examples and quantifiable, contextual data to illustrate the scope and impact of MEV. The report also explores strategies and mechanisms to mitigate or eliminate harmful MEV practices.

item.title: RT by @0xTaker: sincerely don't know who uses bridges these days outside of market makers rebalancing inventory -- just use intent-based stuff, it's instant, gives you asset you're looking for, works for most chains; yeah if you're trading the long tail chain you can't expect all the best
item.dc:creator: @gakonst
item.description: sincerely don't know who uses bridges these days outside of market makers rebalancing inventory -- just use intent-based stuff, it's instant, gives you asset you're looking for, works for most chains; yeah if you're trading the long tail chain you can't expect all the best
